Today's Sunday Globe print edition delayed
Production issues are causing late delivery to homes and retail outlets today. The new Globe ePaper, available here, allows the paper to be read in its printed format.

Stoneham crashes leave woman dead, cruiser struck

A woman was killed when her car crashed into a truck parked in the I-93 breakdown lane. An alleged drunk driver later struck a State Police cruiser and tow truck at that accident scene. (Globe, 11:37 p.m.)

Poll: Brown, Warren race deadlocked

A Globe poll found that GOP Senator Scott Brown and Elizabeth Warren remain popular despite a large bloc of voters still undecided about whom to back. (Boston Globe)

Mortgage rates may have struck bottom

Economists predict rates for 30-year mortgages, which briefly rose over 4 percent in March, will keep rising as the economy and housing markets recover. (Boston Globe)
  • 3/31: Searching shadows for end to foreclosure crisis
  • 3/29: US rate on 30-year mortgage back below 4%

Dozens killed in Syria violence

Shells slammed into the central city of Homs today, killing more than two dozen, activists said, as Syria's government defied cease-fire demands. (AP, 11:19 a.m.)
